title: Rates of change - accumulation over an interval

content.question: <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math><math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math> to <math alttext="12"><mn>12</mn></math><math alttext="12"><mn>12</mn></math> to <math alttext="18"><mn>18</mn></math><math alttext="18"><mn>18</mn></math> to <math alttext="24"><mn>24</mn></math><math alttext="24"><mn>24</mn></math> to <math alttext="30"><mn>30</mn></math>Drone A<math alttext="plus 17"><mo>+</mo><mn>17</mn></math><math alttext="negative 4"><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math><math alttext="plus 11"><mo>+</mo><mn>11</mn></math><math alttext="negative 5"><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></math><math alttext="negative 3"><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>Drone B<math alttext="plus 5"><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math><math alttext="plus 3"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="plus 3"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="plus 2"><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="plus 3"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> ​Two drones are flying over a given area, and their heights above the ground are changing. The table gives the change in height, in feet, for the drones over successive <math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math>-second intervals. Which of the following is true about the average rates of change for drone A and drone B over the time interval from <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> seconds to <math alttext="t equals 30"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math> seconds?

choices.label: ​The average rates of change are equal.
​The average rate of change for drone A is greater than for drone B.
​The average rate of change for drone B is greater than for drone A.
​The average rates of change cannot be determined because changes in heights are given, not heights of the drones.

content.answer: ​The average rates of change are equal.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
